description.narrative: Strengthening Rule of Law Institutions and Systems throughout Darfur, Joint State Liaison Function (SLF-III).

receiver-org.narrative: Government of Sudan, Republic of the

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1. Number of infrastructures for GoS Prisons Directorate constructed or renovated 1.2. Number of infrastructures for GoS Police constructed or equipped. 1.3. Number of infrastructures for GoS Prosecution offices constructed or equipped. 1.4. Number of infrastructures for GoS judiciary offices constructed. 2.1.1 # of GoS District Court Judges trained in line with international standards. 2.1.2 # of GoS Prosecutors and police investigators trained in line with international standards on investigation of cases. 2.1.3 # of Special prosecutors, military prosecutors and police investigators on investigations and prosecutions of serious criminal offences. 2.1.4 # of Civil Society representatives trained on trial monitoring. 2.1.5 # mobile courts organized in return areas in the 4 SLF states. 2.1.6 # JCC established and # paralegals and legal networks mobilized and trained. 2.1.7. # GoS Prison Officers trained on HR approach. 2.1.8 # newly recruited Prison Officers trained on prison duties and HRs 2.1.9. # of SOP in prison operations approved. 2.1.10. # of GoS Police Officers trained on 4 strategic areas

comment.narrative: 1.1.15 1.2.04 1.3.40 1.4.60 1.5.65 1.6.67 1.7.06 1.8.20 mobile court sessions in 2 states 1.9. 4 consultations on land issues

1.1. Enhanced capacities of 60 prosecutors and police investigators in investigative skills and prosecution of SGBV cases 1.2 Enhance management of and operations in prisons through sensitisation of 50 prison managers on SoPs and Mandela Rules 1.3 Built the capacities of 44 rural court judges in record keeping and court proceedings 1.4 Built the capacities of 30 members of CSOs on trail monitoring 1.5 Enhanced the knowledge and skills of 80 prison officers on human rights approach to prison management and application of SOPs in prison operations 1.6 Built the capacities of 120 newly recruited prison officers on prison duties and human rights 1.7 Successfully supported legal aid desks in state prisons and legal aid services extended to indigent offenders 1.8 Successfully conducted mobile court sessions in return areas in 2 states and increased access to justice services 1.9 provided a platform and raised awareness on customary land rights ownership and legal reform in four states of Darfur

1.1.1 Construction of 1 male dormitory, 1 female dormitory, visiting bay, separation wall and child friendly space, in Kass Prison in South Darfur 1.1.2 Construction of 1 male dormitory,1 female dormitory, child friendly space, outside shelter, visiting bay and kitchen in Mellit in North Darfur. (i.e. Police forensic science laboratory, training center, 5 Police Stations, 3police posts, 5 Digital control rooms @SPF HQs) 1.1.3 Construction of 1 new dormitory for male high-risk offenders, vising bay and rehabilitation of the existing male dormitory and sewerage system in Zalingei Prison in the Greater Jebel Marra SLF Area 2.1.1. Three (3) workshops for training for 60 rural court judges in Nertiti, Zalingei and Golo on record keeping and court proceedings as a follow up to requirements of previous trainings on adjudication/mediation of disputes in the Greater Jebel Marra SLF Area in Central Darfur 2.1.2. Two (2) workshops in East & North Darfur for the trainings of General Prosecutors and police investigators in four states on improving coordination between prosecutors and police investigators in the investigation of cases 2.1.3. Two (2) Workshops for civil society on trial monitoring, one (1) in Kabkabiya and one (1) in Kass for a cross section of civil society actors including Bar Association, Women groups, IDP representatives, para-legal, human rights groups. 2.1.4. Support re-establishment of the criminal justice chain by providing logistical support for the operation of mobile courts in return areas in the 2 SLF States. 2.2.1. Organize 2 two weeks in-service training for 130 serving GoS prisons officers including 30 from Kabkabiya and 30 from Kass on human rights approach to prison management and application of SoPs in prisons operations 2.2.2. 1 National Prison Development Committee Meetings to deliberate on Prison strategic issues and validation for adoption of SoPs on prisons operations. 2.2.3. Two (2) two-week initial training for 60 newly recruited prison officers on prison duties and human rights approach in Nertiti and Kutum in the Greater Jebel Marra SLF Area 2.2.4. Organize 3 weeks initial training for 200 newly recruited prisons officers on prison duties and human rights, with 1 courses in South Darfur to address the staffing requirement for the newly constructed federal prison complex in Nyala , 1 in East and 1 in West Darfur with each at USD 7500 per programme. 2.2.5. Provision of technical support through weekly meetings with state prisons authorities and staff to provide advice and mentoring on the job training 2.2.6. Support for the strengthening of six legal aid desks in prison through CBOs/CSO networks (service providers -lawyers) provision of legal assistance to indigent offenders in accessing justice services. 2.3.1. Support the Human Resource Information Management Systems for Sudanese Police Force in the four states of Darfur 2.3.2. Organize 04 ToTs courses for 102 SPF Officers as follows: 01 ToT on public order management for 17 SPF participants; 01 ToT on Criminal Investigation for 17 SPF Participants; 01 ToT on Crime Scene Management for 17 SPF Participants; 01 ToT on Human Rights for 17 SPF Participants; 01 ToT on Crisis management for 17 SPF Participants and 01 ToT on Protection of Civilian for 17 SPF Participants in the Greater Jebel Marra SLF Area of Central Darfur 2.4.1. State level Land law reform focusing on customary right of ownership, recognizing women access to land in the 4 SLF States

1.1.1 Assessments were completed, end user approval of designs secured, and the procurement process is ongoing where evaluations have been successfully completed and sent to the UNDP Regional Office in Amman for approval 1.1.2 Assessments were completed, end user approval for designs secured, and the procurement process is ongoing where evaluations have been successfully completed and sent to the UNDP Regional Office in Amman for approval 1.1.3 Assessments were completed, end user approvals secured, and the procurement process is being initiated 2.1.1 Undertaking consultations with the Judiciary on implementation of the training programme for rural court judges in Central Darfur 2.1.2 Conducted consultations with the General Prosecutor’s Offices in East and North Darfur States on implementation of the trainings 2.1.3 Undertaking consultations with the partners in North and South Darfur states on implementation of the trainings 2.1.4 Conducted consultations with the Judiciary in North and West Darfur States 2.2.1 Conducted consultations with the State Directorate and Prison Reform of North and South Darfur States on implementation of the trainings 2.2.2 Consultations to be undertaken with Jebel Marra Prison authorities and HQ in Khartoum on the implementation of the activity 2.2.3 Undertaking consultations with the State Directorate and Prison Reform on implementation of the training programme for newly recruited prison officers in Central Darfur 2.2.4 Undertaking consultations with the Judiciary on implementation of the training programme for rural court judges in Central Darfur 2.2.5 Advisory services being extended remotely to prisons authorities 2.2.6 Conducted consultations with the State Directorate and Prison Reform and other key partners in all the 5 Darfur States 2.3.1 Undertaking consultations with SPF authorities in all the four Darfur states on implementation of the activity 2.3.2 2 out of the 4 planned ToT courses for SPF in Jebel Marra area, Central Darfur commenced in Zalingei for a total of 34 police officers but halted after one week of implementation due to the outbreak of the nova corona virus and government policies of social distancing 2.4.1 Undertaking consultations with authorities and land committees in all the four Darfur states on implementation of the activity
N/A. The project has commenced its activities in 2020.
N/A. The project has commenced its activities in 2020.
